item.title: Neighborhood crimes rates observations
item.description: Part 1 Abstraction my abstract, We use Sharla Gelfand (n.d.). This research is designed to observe which crimes happened most in Toronto and the change rate of crimes. Part. 2 Introduction The data set I used is “Neighborhood crimes rates” . this dataset record the numbers of six kinds of the crimes in different neighborhoods in toronto. These crimes are assault, auto theft, burglary, homicide, robbery and theft. With the different population of different neighborhoods and too many neighborhoods, what I focus on is the average number of different crimes per 100,000 people from 2014 – 2019 and the changing rate from 2018 to 2019 because they have the same assumption.
